availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. notesStmt.note: An abridgment of a reissue by Pope Alexander VI of the Bull of Innocent VIII, "Romanus pontifex".
Dated at end: Dat[um] Rome apud Sanctu[m] Petru[m] anno incarnationis d[omi]nice. M.CCCC.lxxxxiiij. non[is] Octobris ..
Reproduction of the original in Eton College. Library.

projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,363 texts created during Phase 1 of the project have been released into the public domain as of 1 January 2015. Anyone can now take and use these texts for their own purposes, but we respectfully request that due credit and attribution is given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).
Keying and markup guidelines are available at the Text Creation Partnership web site.

keywords.term: Elizabeth, -- Queen, consort of Henry VII, King of England, 1465-1503.

div.p:
Atate Catholico
rum Regum et principū illo
rum
que ſtatus conſeruatione et manutencione et a ſcandalis bellis ac diſcenſionibus preſeruatione prouide conceſſa fuerunt plenam obtincant roboris firmitatem non nun
quam tamen Roman̄ pontifex illa libenter de nouo approbat. et etiam innouat vt eo firmiꝰ illibata perſiſtant quo magis ſuo fuerint preſidiae cōmunita. dudum ſiquidem a felicis Recordationis Innocentio papa octauo predeceſſore noſtro emanarunt littere tenoris ſubſequentis.

INnocentius ep̄s ſeruus ſeruo
rum dei Ad perpetuā Rei memoriā Roman̄ Pontifex in quo poteſtatꝭ plenitudo ꝯſiſtit inter curas multiplices qui
bus re
rum negotio
rum
que varietati
bus ꝯtinue premit
ur ad ea ex debito paſtoralis officij ſibi ꝯmiſſi ſolicite intēdere debet ꝑ que inter catholicos Principes co
rum
que vaſallos et ſubditos pacis & quietis coadiuuante dn̄o ꝯſeruet
ur amenitas et que hijs ꝯtraria ſūt ac ſcandala ꝓducūt ꝓ ſue vigilantie ſtudiū radicitus extirpent
ur prout ꝑſonar
rum locor
rum & tempor
rum qualitate penſata id in dn̄o ꝯſpicit ſalubriter expedire. Nuper ſiquide ꝑ parte Cariſſimi in xp̄o filij nt'i nostri Henrici .vij. Anglie regis Illuſtris et dilecte in xp̄o filie nobilis mulieris Elizabeth clare memorie Edwardi .iiij. dicti Regni olim regis primogenite nobis expoſito qd ip̄i ad ſūmouendū ꝯtentiones que de regno ip̄o fuerāt inter eo
rum predeceſſores de Lancaſtrie de qua ip̄e rex Henricus et Eboracen̄ inclitis domi
bus & familijs dicti Regni de qua Elizabeth p̄tati originē trahebāt qua
rum occaſione in regno ip̄o grauia ſcandala retroactis tempori
bus exorta fuerāt deſiderabāt inuicē matrimoniū ꝯtrahere ſed qia quarto & quarto ꝯſanguinitatis et forſan affinitatis gradi
bus inuicē ꝯiuncti erant eo
rum deſideriū huiuſmodi in ea parte adimplere nō poterāt diſpenſatione apl'ica de ſuꝑ nō obtenta. Nos tūc cupientes ꝑpetue tranquillitati paci & quieti dicti Regni quēadmodū decet piū et ꝯmunē patrē et paſtorē oīm xp̄iano
rum
ꝓuidere ac diſcordijs q̄ in eo Regno diu inter deſcendentes ex domi
bus p̄dictis cū maximo ip̄ius Regni detrimēto viguerāt finē imponere illud
que futuris diſſentioni
bus occurrendo pacatū & quietū ꝑpetuis tempori
bus reddere ac xp̄iani ſanguinis effuſionē euitare cū eiſdē Henrico rege et Elizabeth vt huiuſmodi ꝯſanguinitatꝭ & forſan affinitatis impedimētis nō obſtanti
bus matrimoniū inter ſe ꝯtrahere & in eo poſtquā cō tractū foret remanere libere et licite poſſent ꝑ alias nrās lrās gratioſe diſpenſauimꝰ ſuſcipiendā ex huiuſmodi matrimonio prolem legitimā nuntiando. Cū autē ſicut accepimꝰ Henricus rex p̄fatus quanquā nō modo iure belli ac notorio & indubitato proximo ſucceſſionis titulo ve
rum
etiā oīm p̄lato
rum procerū Magnatū Nobiliū totiuſ
que eiuſdē Regni Anglie plebis electione et voto. necnō decreto ſtatuto & ordinatione ipſius Anglie Regni trium ſtatuū in ip̄o
rum ꝯuentu Parliamento nūcupato ꝓpter hoc publice et generaliter celebrato ius ip̄iꝰ Regni Anglie ad ip̄m Henricū. vij. Anglie regē ſuoſ
que heredes ſuo ex corpore ꝓcreandos indubitanter et de iure ꝑtineret eidem
que delatū foret ad oēs tamen diſcordias et diſſentiones q̄ olim inter illuſtres Lancaſtrie et Eboracen̄ domos p̄dictas viguerāt tollendas at
que imꝑpetuū abolendas ac ꝓ firma et ꝑpetua pace in eodē Regno obſeruanda ad precipuā & ſpecialem ip̄o
rum trium ſtatuū dicti Regni requiſitionē aſſenſerit eandē Elizabeth principiſſam inmortalis fame regis Edwardi prefati primogenitā & verā heredē ducere habere
que in vxorē dūmodo primitꝰ a nobis oportuna diſpenſatio ſuꝑ impedimentis p̄dictis obtineret
ur . Nos qi vna cū venerabili
bus fr̄i
bus nr̄is ſancte Roman̄ eccl'ie Cardinali
bus oīa et ſingula ſupradicta paterna caritate ꝯſiderantes nō ſolū ſuꝑ matrimonio huiuſmodi inter Henricū regē & Elizabeth principiſſam p̄fatos vt prefert
ur ꝯtrahendo ex cauſis ſupradictis ꝑ dictas nrās lrās diſpenſauimꝰ ſed etiā prolem ſuſcipiendā ex eo ad ſuccedendū eiſdē Regi et Elizabeth legitimā nūtiauimꝰ ꝓut in ip̄iꝰ diſpenſacionis lt̄is pleniꝰ ꝯtinet
ur motu ꝓprio nō ad Henrici regis aut Elizabeth p̄dicto
rum aut alteriꝰ pro eis nobis ſuꝑ hoc oblate petitionis inſtantiā ſed de nrā mera liberalitate & ex certa nrē ſcientia huiuſmodi diſpenſationē necnō matrimoniū vigore illius ꝯtrahendū ſeu cuiuſuis alteriꝰ diſpeniationis deſuꝑ a ſede apl'ica vel illius penitentiaria aut legatis ſiue nuntijs ad id facultatē ab eadē ſede habenti
bus forſan obtente ꝓ tempore ꝯtractū qua

ur habere volumꝰ ꝓ expreſſis legitimā
que libero

rum ac heredū ſuo

que declaramꝰ ſupplemuſ
que
oēs & ſingulos defectꝰ tam iuris quā facti ſiqui forſan interuenerint in eiſdē aut aliquo p̄miſſor
rum monemuſ
que et requirimꝰ motu ſcientia & auctoritate p̄dictꝭ oēs & ſingulos dicti Regni Incolas & eiuſdē Henrici regis ſubditos cuiuſcū
que gradꝰ ſtatꝰ ſeu ꝯditioīs exiſtūt. etiā ſí Ducali vel maiori dignitate prefulgeāt eiſ
que et cuilibet co
rum diſtricte p̄cipiendo inhibemꝰ ne ip̄i aut aliqis eo
rum nouos tumultꝰ occaſione iuris ſuccedendi huiuſmodi vel quocū
que quouis queſito colore aut quacū
que alia cauſa in eodē Regno ꝑ ſe vel aliū ſeu alios mouere ſeu moueri facere diſpenſationi declarationi et decreto huiuſmodi aut paci tranquillitati ne ip̄iꝰ Anglie regni ꝯtraueniendo quouis modo preſumāt ſub ex cōicatioīs & maioris anathematꝭ pena quā oēs et ſinguli huiuſmodi tumultꝰ nouos excitātes vel excitari facientes at
que pacē et Regni p̄fati trāquillitatē poſt hac ne • er ꝑturbātes aut p̄dictis ꝯtraueniēte ••
〈◊◊〉 extūc et extūc put 〈◊◊〉 vt p̄fert
ur dignitatꝭ ſtatꝰ gradꝰ ſeu
〈…〉 . etiā ſi Du ••• aut 〈…〉 dignitate eo, ip̄ò incurrāt euſ
que incuriere & illiꝰ vinculo inno • at • s et inuoluſ •• s ip̄o facto eſſe eiſdē motu ſcientia & auctoritate volumꝰ ſtauimꝰ decernimꝰ at
que declaramꝰ aquoquidē excōicationis & anathematis vinculo ab alio quā ſede apl'ica p̄fata aut cui ip̄a ſedes id ſpecialiter & ſpecifice ꝯmiſerit p̄ter quā in mortis articulo ꝯſtituti nequeāt abſolutionis beneficiū obtinere et ſi qd deus auertat ꝯtingat ip̄am Elizabeth prole ex dicto Herico rege nō ſuſcepta vel ſuſcepta nō tamen tūc ſuꝑſtite decedere ante ip̄m Regē eo caſu prolem ex ip̄o rege Henrico et alia quacū
que eiꝰ legitima vxore ab eo ſuꝑducenda in ōni iure hereditario Regni huiuſmodi iuxta antedictū ip̄iꝰ Parliamenti decretū & huiuſmodi nrām illiꝰ approbationē & ꝯfirmationē ſuꝑ huiuſmodi decreto et alijs p̄
• ictis vt p̄mittit
ur
factā ſuccedere debere ſimili
bus motu ſcientia & auctoritate etiā decernimꝰ & declaramꝰ. et ne in huiuſmodi euentū quiſpiā prolis p̄fate ſucceſſionē huiuſmodi quouis q̄ſito colore impedire aut ad impediendū nouos tumultꝰ in codē regno ꝑ ſe vl' alios excitare aut excitari facere vel ꝓcurare p̄ſumat ſub prefatꝭ ceſuris & penis quas oēs et ſinguli nouos tumultꝰ vt prefert
ur ex quacū
que cauſa in ꝯtrariū excitātes aut excitari facientes eo ip̄o incurrāt et a qui
bus ab alio quā ſede p̄dicta et cui ſedes ip̄a id ſpecialiter cōmiſerit abſolui nequeāt preterquā in mortis articulo ꝯſtituti pari motu ſcientia & auctoritate ꝓhibemꝰ & quoſcū
que tam principes exteros quā dicti Regni Incolas p̄ſtantes opem & ſuccurſū eidē Henrico regi eiuſ
que deſcendēti
bus in eodē regno ſucceſſori
bus Anglie regi
bus ꝯtra eo
rum rebelles aut aliqua ꝯtra p̄miſſa quouis pacto moliētes eiſdem motu ſcientia & auctoritate benedicimꝰ et illis quos ſic faciendo in tam iuſta cauſa decedere ꝯtingeret plenariā oīm ſuo

rum officio

bus ꝯgruis totiens quotiens requiſiti fuerint excōicatos et anathematizatos eſſe & huiuſmodi ſentencias et cenſuras incurriſſe publice nuntient faciāt
que ab alijs nuntiari & ab oī
bus aretius euitari. ac legitimis ſuꝑ hijs habendis ſeruatꝭ ꝓceſſi

apl'icis ꝯceſſis quo

rum
que totis tenori
bus ſeu queuis alia expreſſio habenda eſſet et in eis caueret
ur expreſſe qd illis nō intelligeret
ur vnquā derogatū niſi dū et quotiens ſub certis inibi expreſſis modo & forma ꝯtingeret derogari p̄ſenti
bus ꝓ expreſſis et inſertis habentes quo ad p̄miſſa ſpecialiter et expreſſe derogamꝰ ꝯtrarijs quibuſcū
que . Seu ſi eiſdē Ep̄is Abbati
bus Decanis Archidiaconis Canonicꝭ Rectori
bus Vicarijs ꝑpetuis Priori
bus Guardianis et alijs eccl'iaſticis perſonis ac Duci
bus et alijs p̄dictis vel quibuſuis alijs cōmuniter vel diuiſim a dicta ſit ſede indultū qd interdici ſuſpendi vel excōicari nō poſſint ꝑ lrās apl'icas nō facientes plenā & expreſſam. ac de verbo ad verbū de indulto huiuſmodi mentionē & qualibet alia dicte ſedis indulgentia generali vel ſpeciali cuiuſcū
que tenoris exiſtat. ꝑ quā preſenti
bus
nō expreſſam vel totaliter nō inſertā effectꝰ ea
rum impediri valeat quomodolibet vel differri & de qua cuiuſ
que toto tenore habenda ſit in nt̄is lt̄is mentio ſpecialis. Nulli ergo ōnino hoīm liceat hāc paginā nrē ꝯfirmationis approbationis ꝓnūtiationis ꝯſtitutionis declarationis ſuppletionis monitionis requiſitionis inhibitionis volūtatꝭ ſtatuti decreti ꝓhibitionis benedictionis ꝯceſſionis mandati & derogationis infringere vel ei auſu temerario ꝯtraire. Siquis autē hoc attemptare preſumpſerit indignationē ōnipotentis dei ac beato
rum Petri et Pauli apl'o
rum
eius ſe nouerit incurſurū. Dat
ur Rome apud Sanctumpetrū Anno Incarnationis dominice Milleſimo quadringenteſimo octuageſimo ſexto Sexto kl' Aprilis Pontificatus noſtri Anno Secundo.

Nos igit
ur cupientes nō minꝰ ꝓſpicere et ꝯſulere quieti prefati regis ac Regni ſui
quam fecerit ip̄e Innocentius predeceſſor motu proprio nō ab ip̄iꝰ regis vel alteriꝰ ꝓ eo nobis ſuꝑ hoc oblate petitionis Inſtantiā Sed de nrā liberalitate lt̄as p̄dictas ac oīa et ſingula in eis ꝯtenta auctoritate apl'ica thenore preſentiū approbamꝰ ac plenū firmitatꝭ robur obtinere decernimꝰ iliaſ
que in oī
bus & ꝑ oīa de nouo innouamꝰ & ꝯcedimꝰ nō obſtanti
